As an AI language model, I cannot give medical advice. However, there is no specific amount of time that is recommended for meditation, as it can vary based on the individual's needs and schedule. Some people may meditate for just a few minutes each day, while others may meditate for longer periods, such as 20, 30 or 60 minutes. 

It is recommended that beginners start with a shorter amount of time, such as five or ten minutes, and gradually increase the time as they become more comfortable with the practice. Consistency is key, so it's better to meditate for a shorter period of time daily, rather than sporadically for longer periods. 

Ultimately, the most important thing is to find a consistent practice that works for you, both in terms of the length of time and the time of day that you meditate. With consistent daily practice, you will likely begin to see the benefits of meditation for mental health and well-being.
